page.title: 19Footpaths in Collingham
page.content: In 1983-84 the network of foot and bridle paths was somewhat revised as part of a county policy to ensure that they are useable. This was not so in Collingham previously in many cases where{ {diagonal and headland paths }had been ploughed out,cropped and obstructed. The pattern now replaces some diagonal with headland paths,new routes have been negotiated,some abandoned such that the network meets leisure needs rather than exactly displaying its historical origins.Paths through the village have been maintained and old routeways diverted through new estates being well used.The revised wide network has been well signposted, stiles and footbridges erected.To protect the rights of the walking villagers it is intended to pursue a policy which stops future obstruction.
